entry.et: Middle English bene, from Old English bēan; akin to Old High German bōna bean

def.dt: :broad bean
:the seed of any of various erect or climbing plants (as of the genera Phaseolus and Vigna) of the legume family other than the broad bean
:a plant bearing beans
:an immature bean pod used as a vegetable
:a valueless item
:the least amount didn't know beans about it
:any of various seeds or fruits that resemble beans or bean pods coffee beans
:a plant producing these
:exuberance used in the phrase full of beans
:nonsense bunkum used in the phrase full of beans
:head brain
:a protuberance on the upper mandible of waterfowl see duck illustration
:to strike (a person) on the head with an object
:a person involved in corporate or government financial decisions and especially one reluctant to spend money
:tofu
:the sprouts of bean seeds especially of the mung bean used as a vegetable
:cellophane noodle
:an annual bushy leguminous plant (Vigna angularis syn. Phaseolus angularis) widely grown in Japan and China for its seeds which are used as food and to produce a flour
:its seed
:a black kidney bean commonly used in Latin American cuisine
:a black soybean commonly used usually fermented in east Asian cuisine
:the large flat edible seed of an Old World upright vetch (Vicia faba)
:this plant widely grown for its seeds and as fodder called also fava bean compare favism
:lima bean: as
:a dried lima bean
:sieva bean
:wax bean
:a green shell bean especially as opposed to a snap bean
